item.title: bloggercat
item.description: This is my cat, Sumo. He likes RStudio, mouse toys, and staring out windows.

item.title: python
item.description: #install.packages("reticulate") library(reticulate) import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import seaborn as sns import numpy as np import pandas as pd df = sns.load_dataset('titanic') print(df) ## survived pclass sex age ... deck embark_town alive alone ## 0 0 3 male 22.0 ... NaN Southampton no False ## 1 1 1 female 38.0 ... C Cherbourg yes False ## 2 1 3 female 26.0 ... NaN Southampton yes True ## 3 1 1 female 35.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have been working on: Project 1 Project 2

RMarkdown resume/CV template Based on templates by svmiller and ryanpeek. The only two files that are required to run the RMarkdown is cv-template.Rmd and cv-template.tex, which should be stored in the same directory. What you write in the fields is completely customizable if you know some Markdown. How you format the document requires LaTeX.

item.title: Project 2
item.description: This is a data frame with 1295 rows and 10 columns. The data set contains information about the mortality outcomes for females suffering myocardial infarction. A myocradial infarction is a heart attack and I will refer to it as that throughout the project. It contains a binary variable, ‘outcome’ in which the patient either lived or died. The data set contains 2 numerical variable,‘age’ the age of the onset of theheart attack, and ‘yronset’ the year of the onset of the heart attack.

item.title: Project1_gmc
item.description: Join Function The name of a column was changed so that it may be joined more easily. sech1 <- secher %>% dplyr::select(birthwt = bwt, bpd, ad, no) head(sech1) ## birthwt bpd ad no ## 1 2350 88 92 1 ## 2 2450 91 98 2 ## 3 3300 94 110 3 ## 4 1800 84 89 4 ## 5 2900 89 97 5 ## 6 3500 100 110 6 Tidy Data Example The data was already pretty tidy.

item.title: Resume
item.description: Education Bachelor of Science, Cell and Molecular Biology Expected May 2020 University of Texas at Austin GPA: 3.58 Business Minor Summer 2017 McCombs School of Business, University of Texas at Austin 18 Hours of Business Courses, McCombs Summer Institute Experience Undergraduate Research Assistant Fall 2019 - current Havird Lab, University of Texas at Austin Researched the coevolution of mitochondrial genomes and nuclear genomes in different species of the plant genus, Silene Isolated mitochondria and analyzed the respiration rates of species within the genus, Silene Undergraduate Research Assistant Fall 2018 – Summer 2019
